events.message: The customer submitted a claim after their car was involved in a collision at an intersection, sustaining front-end damage.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and keywords related to vehicle damage.
A claims agent has been assigned to manage the case and contact the customer for further details.
The customer was contacted, and the claim acknowledgement was sent, confirming receipt of the accident report and claim filing.
The agent requested photos of the vehicle damage, police accident report, and driver’s license for verification purposes.
The customer uploaded all requested documents, including detailed images of the collision damage and a copy of the police report.
Investigation into the claim began to assess liability, verify claim authenticity, and estimate repair costs for the vehicle.
The investigation was completed with confirmation of fault and verified the extent of damage to the customer’s automobile.
A settlement offer was presented to the customer covering repair expenses and a rental car reimbursement for the downtime.
The customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the prompt handling of the claim.
The claim was approved formally after the customer accepted the settlement terms and conditions without any further questions.
Payment was issued to the customer’s designated bank account for the agreed settlement amount to cover all approved costs.
The claim case was officially closed after all payments were processed and the customer acknowledged complete resolution.
The claim files and all related documentation were archived securely for future reference and compliance purposes.
